item.title: Account Resource Limits
item.description: The following information outlines the usage limits for specific HPC account types. Compute Hour Limits Time on the Linux computing resource is allocated in core hours. core hours = nodes * cores * hours For example, the use of 1 nodes with 24 CPU cores for three hours is counted as 72 core hours. Most of the HPC compute nodes have 24 CPU cores so if you are unsure of how many cores you are using per node, 24 is a good estimate.
